alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 7:04PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central San Juan County through 745 PM MDT... At 703 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles southeast of Halls Crossing to near Monument Valley Visitors Center. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of south central San Juan County. This includes U.S. Highway 163 in Utah between mile markers 4 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
